Description: Executive stamp (vessel): Three line inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: Cf. Miles 1964, 35. The die was in use during the finance directorship of Nawfal b.Furāt for it is found on two of his heavy weights, a raṭl (Petrie 1926, 154) and a half-raṭl (Balog 1976, 402). Bibliography: Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York; Miles, G.C. 1964a. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo; Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (230)
Associated names: Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Raḥmān b. Yazīd
